column5: Solo mission this time... 11 cats for the day. The last 40 minutes before dark was incredible... might even be the best 40 minutes of fishing I have ever experienced for any species. It took less than a minute to have a cat on each time I cast out during the hot spell... wicked fun. Biggest cat was 32" and 15lbs, and of course, that is the one pic that turned out blurry lol... I love the bright yellow cats... check out the contrast between the yellow cat in the second last pic and the grey cat in the last pic... just too cool.  Learnings for the day:  1) Ten foot downrigger rods + netting big cats alone = challenge! 2) My cooler makes a great camera stand - now I know how to do my muskie shots in the summer 3) When the cats turn on, THEY TURN ON!  Enjoy the pics... I enjoyed making them
You had a great outing. Well done.
congrats on a good day of fishing.
Very nice! Now you know why I love Channel cat fishing so much! Great fighters. Especially in deep water!
Great to see that you are getting them.I will be out today. Still looking for that 25 lb cat.

oh man you're killin' me with those pics! I live just over an hour away from dunville and in three years I still haven't gotten down there for those big brutes!  Great report - congrats on some solid fishing!  Cheers, Ryan
Some nice looking cats!  That lone tree on the bank sure has made it into a lot of photos this spring. Maybe even one or two of those cats have too, ya never know eh?
Great pics...seems like the bite just before and after dark is the best..
Yep Steve... 20 pounder is my next goal... 25 would be incredible!
Yea whats teh deal with the yellos and greys, are they two different species or what ? anyone know about this ? maybe steve knows XD
those are awesome.. very nice report....  is the adrenaline still pumping or have you calmed down--lol  dann
Still pumping... I swear, that 8 fish stretch at the end of the day was the most fun I have ever had fishing.
They look like shaven drowned cats  Nice fish, Looks like fun. Thanks for the report!
